Scenario with MULTIPLE_INTERVAL_SELECTION_TOGGLE mode on a selection model:
select one item click again
Problem: item not toggled to unselected state.
select a second item, and now one can unselect each of the two items without a problem. However:
select two items, click either to unselect. now click again to re-select the same item and nothing happens.
@Fabian, this report hasn't been addressed so far. What's the expected behavior, and can it be determined by a single mode (i.e. without add'tl settings)?
This looks like a bug in the MULTIPLE_INTERVAL_SELECTION_TOGGLE selection mode. We should fix it in 0.9
mass renaming of 0.9 target to 1.0 (for issues with status "NEW")
Assigning all table bugs to Martin.

We only react on mouseup on the focus indicator. On the pane, we react on mouseup, mousedown and click which caused the problem due to different code parts executed. In common scenarios that all works as expected because a cell click event is fired by the mouseup handler of the focus indicator. But if that cell click handler is not fired due to not firing the event twice, the selection wont be updated. In that case, i just invoke the handler of the pane which takes care of that in the case of a pane mouse down.
